summary: This is a transcript of a DOJ Office of the Inspector General interview with a BOP correctional lieutenant (SIS Lieutenant) regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. The interview covers the July 2019 alleged suicide attempt, the circumstances leading to Epstein being left without a cellmate on August 9, 2019, failures in rounds and counts, non-functional cameras, and the events of August 10, 2019.

events.title: Epstein's First Alleged Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found with a noose/rope in his SHU cell. He was interviewed by the SIS lieutenant and stated he did not remember what happened and that cellmate Tartaglione did not harm him. He was placed on suicide watch.

events.title: MCC Camera System Failure
events.description: The MCC's camera recording system stopped working. This was not discovered until August 8, 2019.

events.title: Cameras Discovered Non-Functional
events.description: The SIS lieutenant discovered the camera system was not recording while trying to review footage with an associate warden. She notified the captain and a communications technician.

events.title: Reyes Transferred, Epstein Left Without Cellmate
events.description: Inmate Efrain Reyes was transferred out of MCC (not taken to court as initially believed). Epstein was left without a cellmate, contrary to psychology's requirement. Multiple failures in notification and rounds/counts occurred.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his SHU cell at MCC. He was found with a noose. The camera system was still not functional.

events.title: OIG Interview of SIS Lieutenant
events.description: DOJ OIG agents interview a BOP correctional lieutenant (SIS) as part of the investigation into Epstein's death.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York City
Receiving and Discharge (R&D) area at MCC
keyFacts: The SIS lieutenant conducted the investigation into Epstein's July 2019 alleged suicide attempt and found it inconclusive, though Epstein was placed on suicide watch.

Epstein was required to have a cellmate after coming off suicide watch/psych observation, but his cellmate Reyes was transferred on August 9, 2019, and no replacement was assigned due to multiple notification failures.

The MCC camera recording system had been offline since July 29, 2019, and was not discovered until August 8, 2019. Key personnel (a captain and associate warden) were verbally notified but the system was not fixed.
The lieutenant believes systematic failures—specifically the lack of a cellmate and failures in conducting rounds and counts—were key factors that allowed Epstein to take his own life.
Evidence collected on August 10 included a noose, a CPAP machine, pill bottles, and an excessive amount of linen in Epstein's cell, which was noted as a security issue.
